intro: Twisselmannia californica, commonly known as the California twisselmannia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of California. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species from threats such as habitat loss and climate change.
